page.title: 14WILDLIFE IN OUR AREA
page.content: WILDLIFE IN OUR AREA by MATTHEW WILMOT THIS IS AN ACCOUNT ABOUT THE WILDLIFE IN THE AREA.THE LOCAL ENVIROMENT HAS MANY BIRD RESIDENT AREA'S.FOR HERE IS AN EXAMPLE OF A BIRD WHICH SPENDS ITS LIFE ON A RISTRICKED AREA.THIS BIRD IS A COOT.THE COOT LIVES ON PONDS AND LAKES.HERE WE CAN RECOGNISE IT BY ITS RED EYE AND WHITE BILL.ON THE TOP OF THE BILL THERE IS A SHIELD WHICH ALSO IS WHITE.THE COOT FEEDS ON A RANGE OF WATER WEED AND SOME KINDS OF FISH FRY. THE ANIMAL POPULATION IS QUITE HIGH. THIS IS BECAUSE THE HABITATS ARE NUMEROUS.FOR EXAPLE THE SKYLARK CHOOSES THE FIELD FOR ITS NESTS.THE FARMERS TRAP AND SHOOTS ANIMALS FOR SPORT.THERE IS ALSO A HELP FOR THE ANIMALS.THE HELP IS A NATURE RESERVE CALLED RIMAC.IT STRECHES FROM SALTFLEET TO NORTH END MABLETHORPE.
